body_html:
I would be happy if it would be just slower in the elu gradient...
NB the problem is in the creation of the graph, not even in the computation!
Try the code i sent, is a very small piece of code, and it does not even initialize a session.
It is a problem with flags in the parallel_for function in tensorflow
absl.flags._exceptions.UnparsedFlagAccessError: Trying to access flag
--op_conversion_fallback_to_while_loop before flags were parsed.

with use_pfor=False, there does not seem to be this issue (but of course this renders the whole computation way slower since is not using the parallel for but the tf.while I think..)
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/parallel_for/gradients.py

body:
I would be happy if it would be just slower in the elu gradient...
NB the problem is in the creation of the graph, not even in the computation!
Try the code i sent, is a very small piece of code, and it does not even initialize a session.
It is a problem with flags in the parallel_for function in tensorflow
**absl.flags._exceptions.UnparsedFlagAccessError: Trying to access flag
--op_conversion_fallback_to_while_loop before flags were parsed.**

with `use_pfor=False`, there does not seem to be this issue (but of course this renders the whole computation way slower since is not using the parallel for but the tf.while I think..)
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/parallel_for/gradients.py
